column4: i'm trying to set up a firefox profile that is to be copied to a set of machines.. this worked just beautiful on the firefox version running on ubuntu intrepid, but after upgrading to jaunty (and firefox 3.0.9) this has stopped working.. firefox starts, but freezes after a couple of seconds.. in the process list it's listed as defunc..
is nfs involved?
correct
firefox (or really sqlite) can get really unhappy if the profile directory is on nfs (related to (stale or malfunctioning) filesystem locks)
well.. it works if i just wipe the existing .mozilla folder
symptoms usually include bogus "profile in use" messages and the address bar and bookmarks/history malfunctioning completely.
firefox just don't work here..
it launches and loads the home page, but then freezes entirely
if i remove the .mozilla folder and start firefox, it works just fine
hmm. Wild guess: is this a terminal server-ish setup with tons of firefox instances running on one system?
nope
one firefox for each computer
err, wait, that wouldn't explain it working without .mozilla. Can you narrow it down to a particular file you're copying?
any idea about my problem?
i know using just a single user account for all the lab machine is a "bad idea" by design, but i don't think it's technically relevant..
I'm assuming the unionfs setup lets you kill files in the profile directory one by one? Deleting which file makes it work again? Alternatively try strace-ing firefox to see what it gets stuck on.
i've tried that deleting file-by-file approach, but then i just ended up with it not starting at all :)
but i'll try strace and see what happens
that's really odd (if deleting the entire profile works so should deleting it file by file...)
yeah.. one would assume
there's a .parentlock in there you might've missed, but I wouldn't expect that to cause this. Or it might be the directory or profiles.ini, but I don't see how that could be either.
i tried that file as well
